title: Enable SAM
content:
Prerequisites

To access the new SAM capability, you need to:

  • Assign an Asset Management license to your tenant
  • Enable Native SACM for your tenant

Architecture overview

The following architecture diagrams describe how SAM can be deployed. You can choose either the multi-deployment mode or the classic deployment mode.

Multi-deployment: Deploy Service Management and Universal Discovery and CMDB (UD/UCMDB) on the same Kubernetes cluster, in an on-premises, AKS, EKS, or OpenShift environment. 

Classic deployment: Install classic UCMDB Server and classic UCMDB Gateway.

Support matrix

To enable SAM, install UCMDB Server of versions described in Service Management integration with Universal Discovery and CMDB.

Deployment procedure

To deploy the SAM capability, follow these steps:

  1. Install UD/UCMDB for SAM
  2. Enable the SAM capability
  3. (Optional) Change the SAM deployment size after installation

For demo or testing purposes, you can deploy SAM's sample data in the environment where you plan to run SAM. For more information, see Deploy sample data.

Related topics

  • To learn about how to use SAM, see New SAM.
  • To troubleshoot SAM-related issues, see Troubleshoot SAM.
